intro: Lasianthus chrysophyllus, commonly known as the golden-leafed lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its striking golden-yellow foliage and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
